reviews.review_msg: She was very clear and concise about lecture material. Midterms were reasonable but the final was bs.
Exams were fine if you attended the lectures. Some students just gave the wrong information on this website. She is a good professor. The TAs were just ok
If you attend her lectures , you should be fine. She is good.

She taught this course quite well. She listens to the students and answers questions. She also asks questions during the class for active participation .Some students in the class created a distraction for other students and the instructor. 200 plus students in this class
good professor. definitely will take a course again from her. She asks questions in the class and expects the students to participate. Practice questions are also given.

I passed this course because of Maliha's good teaching skills. She is very approachable and nice to her students. She encouraged the students to ask questions and answered it well. teaching such a big class of 200 plus students requires skills and i think she was great.

She is a caring professor and explains the concepts very well. SFU is lucky to have her. I took other courses with her as she was teaching 4 classes in Spring and econ 115 had 200 plus students. She is passionate and related the theory with the real life examples. Some students created regular distraction multiple times and she handled it well.

Professor Maliha is truly one of the best instructors I've had. Her lectures are clear, engaging, and well-organized. She genuinely cares about her students' success and is always willing to help outside of class. I left her class feeling not only more knowledgeable but also more confident. Highly recommend her if you get the chance!

Maliha is a good professor. If you are present in the lectures and ask her questions, she will explain it. She mentioned that there will be questions from the guest speaker lecture in the exam. Just because some students found the final exam hard , they are unhappy. Overall good experience.
You want to get a good grade for the course and see her for help during office hours, you should be fine. She is caring and patient and explains the concepts very well.

Dr. Nazir is a great instructor. Her lectures were easy to understand. The exams were just fine as long as you read the textbook. The presentations & her teaching style is great.  Wonder why some classmates have given bad feedback. The canvas website for the course was organized for the modules. The TAs created and uploaded the assignments.

i dont even know where to start tbh. Read everyone elses reviews about her and make sure to believe them cus they not lying.The content itself is nowhere near as complicated as she makes it. She has no idea what shes doing seems like shes learning content while she tries reading it to us during the lectures.

She only reads off the slides in class, in the most boring tone ever. The textbook is even more well represented of the content than her slides. Final exam was harder than the midterms, with questions nobody expected, including 3 written questions, directly asking what the guest speaker had said.

Maliha Nazir is a nice person, but, in terms of teaching, SHE IS HORRIBLE. The lectures are boring and it's no one shows up to class because it is not engaging whatsoever. You don't need to show up for lectures, however you do need to show up for tutorials that will probably teach you nothing. Just keep up with the content and you'll be fine.

Yes the final was a bit crazy, yes it was 18 pages, yes there was stuff on it she said wouldn't be. Overall though, she's meh, she presents the material in a monotone voice, so fun and interesting topics can easily turn boring with her. Syllabus was fair, and grading scheme made sense. Study hard, and ask questions. You'll be fine.

Looking at the grade, you should think "I enjoyed this class", however, Dr. Nazir essentially punishes you for hard work. The more u use her assignments, mock exams, whatever; the more she dunks on you with the amount of errors. You question yourself here and there, eventually seeing no point in studying. It is painful how much time she wastes you.

1 She tests you on guest speaker content i.e “what were her exact words”
2 Final exam questions have too many in-exam mistakes
3  She only gives you a practice exam with the answers on it, and even the answers are wrong.
4 Expect “$3.12 billion, 47.4 thousand” what is the GDP per capita-no decimal answers allowed
Just a few examples, just avoid her

She is by far the most unaccommodating professor at Sfu. Makes notes and in class questions look so easy and then gives the hardest possible exam asking questions never mentioned in class. Very demotivating as a student and an absolute clown show. Unfair course, final exam was ten times harder than anything taught in class. Avoid at all costs!

She was okay for 115, but mainly because the course isn't very difficult. I felt the exams did reflect the practice exams she gave, but as others have said, her assignments had so many errors. She was pretty disorganized and treated the class like high schoolers. I feel like her teaching style is better suited for community colleges.

Dr. Nazir shows extreme disrespect towards students, showing 0 responsibility or any eagerness to improve. She failed as a professor through the complete disorganization of the lecture, pulling assignments and exams online without proofreading if she covered them  made students waste unnecessary time in class and future students MUST avoid her.

This professor is insane. 

The amount of errors in her assignments and exams is unbelievable. The terms and questions used in the assignments were never once mentioned in lecture. It is almost like wasting student's time is her hobby - when she brought a guest speaker for a day to just talk about her achievements, then tests us on her lecture.

She wastes time trying to explain slides, doesn't give us breaks, and gets angry when students walk out of lectures. The exams were nothing like the practice exams, and on the exams, she uses terms she's never taught. She got very angry when a student asked why the exam was nothing like the practice exams (She said it wasn't her problem).
Lectures are useless. she wastes so much time and gets mad when students are uninterested. she doesn't seem to understand the concepts
Just don't take any class with her, save yourself the stress. I don't recommend.

The class itself was honeslty way easier than I expected. the practice mid terms were basically the exams we had. as long as you keep up to date with the slides and textbook readings you should be fine. Prof is super unorganized and really stupid. TA saved me for this class. Final was more difficult that midterms. prof wasted alot of time in lecs.

Ms Nazir, while knowledgeable is very disorganized. When she's not wasting time, her classes are pretty dry and she frequently does not explain really basic concepts. The midterms were pretty easy and the final was a  bit harder and the homework given was manageable. However all three exams had errors in the questions. Overall, I would avoid her
think twice before taking any class with her. I am the second year student and she is the worst so far

Reads from slides, textbook not necessary to read imo, doesn't discuss important content in class but instead in assignments/tutorials, some content we never learnt at all were in midterms, super unorganized. Attending lectures isn't that beneficial.

Asking your TA questions/going to tutorials is extremely helpful here.

Maliha is a genuine person, but her lectures are awful. She's very unorganized, we've had one proper lecture since our last midterm and we are expected to know so much material that wasn't covered in class for the final exam.

Maliha did not know how to teach or to make a class interesting at all. There is no need to attend her classes, as all she does in class is read from the slides which she posts regularly. Incapable of answering questions on the spot. Wastes time asking useless questions. However, the class is very easy, would recommend taking it for easy credits.
Fantastic prof. Lectures are in depth and she explains slides in a concise and simple manner. Practice midterms are very similar to the midterms so keep track of that.

She can't do anything right. She literally always makes mistakes with her quizzes and assignments. When she is also teaching, she seems to not know what she is saying half the time. Honestly lecture might be the most useless thing ever. Her slides are basically copied and pasted from the textbook.
Pretty good!

prof is nice and entertaining. make sure to practice midterms and some of the questions are really similar. I lowkey found this class harder than Econ 113 which is opposite than others. But the average is really high and this class is curved. Make sure you do better than the class or close to class average.
Never responds to email and super strict on every single policy. This is an intro econ course and made me never want to take another econ class with him again

Santamaria is a good prof and wants his students to do well. Lectures aren't really engaging, but that's the nature of a big class size. Content is manageable, and your grade is entirely test-based. To do well on tests I recommend you study all the practice problems repeatedly, more than textbook.
Dont take him he is the worst doesn't transfer the  weight  to the other exams and its very tough

I took this class and had an amazing time with Martin. Lectures felt really long but Martin knows how to keep you engaged. The curve is high and I also had an amazing TA. One of my favourite classes by far as well. Study off the practice exams they really help !

Had a great time in his ECON115 course. Lectures (not mandatory) felt long but he tried to make them as engaging as he could. All the exams were almost identical to previous practice exams (which he posted on Canvas). Just do all the practice questions and attend tutorials, it's easy to get a good mark. Just beware that the curve is quite high!
